content.description: Probably a V2/3. Fairly Direct with a bit of high feet/ smearing. The holds are crimpy, but positive and good. The one very nice positive crimp jug for the top out ripped off so now that’s about a 10mm sloper-ish crimp but it’s still good.
content.protection: Have a pad for each big boulder and one that can fill the gap between them.
content.location: Starts to the right of “Good Things Fall Apart”. There is a left side pull crimp and a right crimp to start. There’s a left foot and right foot for the start low down.

content.description: Easy problem to warm up on. Start the same as Don't Pop my tube. Traverse right past where the two rock meet and top out. Watch out for the head jam.
content.protection: Fall into the water just don't pencil dive. When the lake is drained in the winter, you can bring crash pads.
content.location: The start is the obvious crack in the middle of the rock. Same as Don't Pop My Tube.

content.description: This is a super fun, but long route.  All holds but 3 are crimps, most either slopey or half pad.  The other 3 holds are the starting jug, a mini jug towards the end, and a thumb undercling at the top.  There are two designated footholds, the starting heel hook and a small chip located very low and central in the route.  This one roughs up the fingertips pretty good, tape may be a good idea if you're into that.  Lake water level must be below 840 feet to do this problem, otherwise the bottom of the rock is in the water :(
content.location: The start is the only jug on the left of the face of the boulder.  Two hands start there with a heel hook around an arete to the left.  From there move right along the small ledge with crimps and eventually up and top out towards the right side of the face, you should see a really small undercling just in reach on the top of the boulder, this is the last hold.

content.description: Start on good ledge and move up on good ledges and crystals to a slopey topout
content.location: Left side of paved loop across from cooper's furnace parking

content.description: Easy start moving up the crack. Traverse right to where the two rocks meet. Move up to the right of the tiny crack on the top rock. Shoot for the horn at the top and finish with a sketchy heel hook to top out.
content.protection: Fall into the water just do not pencil dive. When the lake is drained in the winter you can bring crash pads.
content.location: Starts at the obvious crack on the bottom of the rock. Either walk back to beach or jump off into the lake to get down.

content.description: Move straight up. Crux is the sketchy top out with two high feet. Nice right side pull and left side crimp on the top.
content.protection: Fall into the water but don't pencil dive. Crash pads can be used in the winter when the lake is drained.
content.location: To the left of the obvious crack. Stand on small shelf.

content.description: Start on ledge at base and move up on crystals and crimps to a slopey top out.
content.location: Left side of paved loop across from Cooper's furnace parking lot.

content.description: In Red Top Mountain Park near the beach. Sunny right on Lake Allatoona. Shallow water soloing so don't pencil dive in. In the winter when the lake is drained, more of the rock will be available to climb and you will be able to bring crash pads.
